Key Match Events: Mookie Betts hit a solo home run in the first inning
Shohei Ohtani drove a ball down the right-field line
Will Smith blasted another weak pitch over the center-field fence
Pre-Game Insights: The Dodgers entered the game missing two key injured players — Freddie Freeman and Miguel Rojas
The Dodgers were forced to navigate with no starter and all bullpen
The Dodgers predicted they could hit Padres starter Dylan Cease on short rest
Post-Match Reflections: The Dodgers created the drama with a desperation 8-0 victory at Petco Park
The victory gave life to the possibility of one of the greatest postseason series wins in Dodgers history
The fifth and final game in this brawl will take place Friday night at Chavez Ravine
Miscellaneous Highlights: The series opener featured a monster first punch by the home-run-hitting Ohtani
The second game was filled with showboating Padres who taunted bottle-throwing fans
When Game 3 came to San Diego, the Dodgers initially didn’t come with it, failing to show for most of a lackluster loss
Others: The Dodgers have to be thinking about that Friday when they surely will face some of these Dodgers relievers again
The only thing that could stop the Dodgers on this night, it seemed, was third base umpire Mark Ripperger
